The guy manning the desk promptly set us up in another room on the 2nd floor. When we got there we realized that it had only one bathroom -we were supposed to have two, having reserved a "junior suite". So, back down we went with our suitcases and carry-ons. This time we had to tell the FD guy that we were supposed to get a "junior suite" and found out that he gave us a "mini suite". We really didn't want to stay on the 2nd floor anyway -too close to the street and all the noise since Geary is a busy street. So we got our JS, where else, but back on the 5th down the steps next to our first room, but facing the alley instead of the street. Another FD guy who accompanied us to our (third) room warned us of the garbage truck which he said would come at 3:00 in the a.m., but actually came between 6:00 and 7:30 a.m. daily. Aside from that little fiasco, the jr. suite -which is actually 1 room with a queen-sized bed and full bathroom adjoining another room with a pull-out sofa-bed and a full bathroom (with a shower stall) connected by double french doors was adequate. This set-up was a little larger than the mini-suite although it didn't have a balcony, only windows overlooking an alley (which had a hostel at the end of it which made it a little noisy late at night). The room was quite clean (although there was a slight smokey smell as it was a smoking room, although we requested a non), but the furniture was a little worn with scuffs, scratches, and stains on the couch. The hotel's restaurant, La Scene, is quite nice and offers continental breakfast, brunch (on certain days), and dinner. We only had dinner there and it was surprisingly quite good. Also, if you rent a car, there is a parking garage on the corner of Mason and O'Farrell which charges only $15/ night if you're in after 5:30pm and out before 9:30 am (no in-out though), beats coughing-up $35/day at the hotel.
